isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - SELF-STEERING AXLE ASSEMBLIES - INSTALL

svcprocinfo.para: This section contains installation procedures for the self-steering lift axle assembly and the components mounted on the lift axle assembly. Installation procedures for the control panels and panel mounted components are located in the CONTROLS section .

svcsubproc.title: AIR LINES - GENERAL
svcsubproc.para: Air lines can be connected to the quick-connect fittings as follows:

step1.para: Verify that the end of the line is cut clean and square.
Push the air line straight into the fitting.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT AXLE ASSEMBLY
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 21
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Position the lift axle assembly so that the mounting holes in the lift axle side rails are aligned with the mounting holes in the vehicle frame. Clamp axle frame to frame rails to reduce movement.

note.para: When installing a lift axle assembly in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with M16x60 hex flange head bolts.
In the following two steps, install and snug-up all of the mounting hardware before tightening the hardware to the correct torque [265 - 325 N•m (195 - 240 lbf-ft)].

step1.para: Secure the lift axle front hangers to the vehicle frame using six M16x60 hex flange head, grade 10.9 bolts, and nuts for each side.
Secure the lift axle upper load bag mounts to both sides of the vehicle frame using M16x60 hex flange head, grade 10.9 bolts, and nuts.
Remove clamps securing the axle frame to the frame rails.
Connect all supply and control air lines to the lift axle assembly.

item.para: supply line to axle mounted tank (at tank)
brake control line to axle mounted brake relay valve (at valve)
supply line from axle mounted solenoid to pressure regulator (at solenoid)
delivery/control line from pressure regulator to load bag quick release valve (at valve)

step1.para: Connect electrical connection to the lift axle solenoid.
Pressurize the air system.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.
Remove wheel chocks.
Check/perform a wheel alignment on the lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS section .

svcsubproc.title: LOAD BAG

important.para: All air bag hardware; mounting bolts, nuts, and air fittings should be torqued to 33.9 N•m (25 lbf-ft).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 21
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.

note.para: It may be easier to install the load bag if the lift axle is raised to its normal ride height using a jack.

step1.para: Position the load bag on the bottom mounting plate with the air stem inserted into the inside hole of the top mounting plate.
Using the washer and nut, attach the bag air stem to the top mounting plate.

note.para: It may be necessary to loosen the mounting bolt securing the bag's upper mounting bracket to provide access to the upper, outside mounting bolt for the load bag.

step1.para: Secure the load bag to the outside hole of the top mounting plate with the mounting hardware previously removed.
Secure the load bag to the bottom mounting plate with two mounting hardware previously removed.
Connect the air line fitting and air line to the load bag.
Pressurize the air system.
Replace the tire/wheel if it was removed during load bag removal.
Using the axle controls, lower the axle with the replaced bag and check the load bag and the bag connection for air leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT BAG/LIFT BAG QRV

important.para: All air bag hardware; mounting bolts, nuts, and air fittings should be torqued to 33.9 N•m (25 lbf-ft).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 22
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Using the mounting hardware removed previously, install the pivot plate to the front of the lift bag.

note.para: If necessary, the lift axle may be raised with a jack to allow easier installation of the lift bag.

step1.para: Position the lift bag as indicated in the figure with the air stem inserted into the mounting hole of the rear plate. Do not fasten at this time.

note.para: If necessary, lower the lift axle until the pivot pin at the front of the lift bag can be installed.

step1.para: Secure the lift bag pivot plate to the swing arm assembly by inserting the pivot pin (item 2) and locking it into place with a cotter pin.
Secure the lift bag air stem with a mounting nut and washer.
Verify that the air line fitting is attached to the lift bag QRV.
Install the lift bag QRV (item 4) to the bag air stem; then connect the air line to the fitting.
Install the tire/wheel if they were removed earlier for clearance.
Pressurize the air system.
Using the axle controls, set the axle with the replaced bag to its up position.
Check the lift bag and the bag connection for air leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: QUICK RELEASE VALVE FOR LOAD BAGS
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 23
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Before installing the QRV, connect the air line fittings removed from the defective QRV.
Secure the QRV (item 8) to the mounting bracket using the proper mounting hardware.
Connect the air lines to the QRV.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the QRV and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: FULL FUNCTION RELAY VALVE (BRAKES)
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 23
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.

If the QRV (item 8) is currently installed, remove the QRV mounting bracket from the axle assembly. It is NOT necessary to remove the QRV from the mounting bracket or to disconnect the air lines from the valve. Position the QRV and mounting bracket to allow installation of the relay valve (item 10).
Carefully thread the relay valve into the correct port in the air tank (item 1). Install the valve in the same orientation shown in the figure.
Connect the air line fittings to the relay valve.
Connect the air lines to the relay valve.
Secure the QRV mounting bracket and QRV to the axle assembly.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the relay valve and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle brake system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: PRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 23
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect air line fittings to the Pressure Protection Valve (PPV).
Carefully thread the PPV (item 7) into the correct port in the air tank (item 1).
Connect the air lines to the valve.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the PPV and connections for air leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: FIVE PORT VALVE/SOLENOID
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 23
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect air line fittings to the solenoid.
Position the solenoid (item 14) as indicated in the figure and secure with mounting bolts.
Connect the air lines to the solenoid. .
Connect electrical connection to the solenoid.
Pressurize the air system.
Check the solenoid and connections for air leaks.
Using the axle controls, verify correct operation of the lift axle assembly.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE MOUNTED TANK
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 23
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Connect the air line fittings to the tank.
Slip the mounting straps onto the air tank.
Secure the tank mounting straps, and the air tank (item 1), to the axle frame as indicated in the figure.
Install the PPV (item 7), fittings and air lines onto the replacement tank.
Install the brake relay valve (item 10), fittings and air lines onto the replacement tank.
Using the clamping hardware for the air tank straps, secure air tank, the QRV mounting bracket, and the QRV (item 7), to the axle assembly. Connect QRV air lines if they were disconnected earlier.
Connect the supply air line (item 13) to the tank and verify that the correct lines are connected to all tank mounted components.
Pressurize the air system.
Check all components and air line connections for leaks.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

svcsubproc.title: BRAKE MECHANISM
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Group 04 BRAKES in the Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: UPPER ARM BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: The self-steering lift axle has four arm bushings on each side: upper arm, front and rear; and lower arm, front and rear. To prevent the axle from dropping unexpectedly, and/or placing undue stress on axle components; always keep one set of arms connected during bushing replacement. In other words, replace the bushings in both upper (or lower) arms first; then reconnect those arms before disconnecting the other arms. Always support the axle during the entire removal/installation procedure.
Refer to FIGURE 22 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
Install two new bushings into both upper arms.

note.para: When replacing the bushings in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with 0.875in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts.

step1.para: Place the upper arms into position and secure the pivot joints (item 3) using 0.875in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts. After ALL axle bushings have been installed, torque these connections to 678 - 746 N•m (500 - 550 lbf-ft).

If the lower arm bushings have not been replaced yet, proceed to the installation procedures for the LOWER ARM BUSHINGS. If the lower arm bushings have been replaced, torque all pivot connections to 678 - 746 N•m (500 - 550 lbf-ft), and proceed to the next step.
If any components were removed to allow upper arm removal, replace those components now.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.
Pressurize the air system.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

Check/perform an alignment on the lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS
section.

svcsubproc.title: LOWER ARM BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: The self-steering lift axle has four arm bushings on each side: upper arm, front and rear; and lower arm, front and rear. To prevent the axle from dropping unexpectedly, and/or placing undue stress on axle components; always keep one set of arms connected during bushing replacement. In other words, replace the bushings in both upper (or lower) arms first; then reconnect those arms before disconnecting the other arms. Always support the axle during the entire removal/installation procedure.

note.para: Due to the weight of the lower arm, it may be easier to complete the bushing replacement at each end separately. In other words, disconnect the rear pivot joints on both sides, replace the bushings, and reconnect the pivot joints before disconnecting the front pivots.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 22 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Verify that wheel chocks are installed.
If necessary, use a jack to raise or lower the lower arm to allow access to the bushing cavities.
Install new bushings into the lower arms.

note.para: When replacing lift axle bushings in the field, the original Huck fasteners are replaced with 0.875in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts.
When positioning the front of the lower arm in the following step, insure that it is aligned correctly with the pivot plate on the front of the lift bag.

step1.para: Place the lower arms into position and secure the pivot joints (item 1) using 0.875in. grade 8 bolts and locknuts. After ALL axle bushings have been installed, torque these connections to 678 - 746 N•m (500 - 550 lbf-ft).

note.para: If necessary, lower the lift axle until the pivot pin at the front of the lift bag can be installed.

step1.para: Secure the lift bag pivot plate to the swing arm assembly by inserting the pivot pin (item 2) and locking it into place with a cotter pin.

If the upper arm bushings have not been replaced yet, proceed to the installation procedures for the UPPER ARM BUSHINGS. If the upper arm bushings have been replaced, torque all pivot connections to 678 - 746 N•m (500 - 550 lbf-ft), and proceed to the next step.
Install the tires/wheels on the lift axle.
Pressurize the air system.
Verify correct operation of the lift axle system.
Remove wheel chocks.

Check/perform an alignment on the lift axle assembly. Refer to the ADJUSTMENTS
section.
